page.title: 01East of Lumsden/Huntly Rd
page.content: This block consists largely of rolling, rather unspectacular hills, heather covered and rising at several points to heights of just under 500m. Along the western edge ad round the n/e corner runs a narrow strip of farmland. Average altitude of this farmland is about 250m and it is mainly kept under rotation crops with turnips grain, grass, the main object being the rearing of beef cattle. In some parts there is a predominance of rotation grass. The cultivated land rises from west to east, gradually to meet edge of moorland,although there are some forestry plantaitons along this edge. The moor or hill land extends eastwards to extreme edge of block. In general the area is adapted to grouse shooting but there is little other use for the land and there is no habitation on the hilly part
